condition.description:
Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) is a type of bacteria that causes infection in the stomach. It is found in about two-thirds of the world's population. It may be spread by unclean food and water, but researchers aren't sure. It causes Peptic ulcers and can also cause stomach cancer.

If you have symptoms of a peptic ulcer, your doctor will test your blood, breath or stool to see if it contains H. pylori. The best treatment is a combination of antibiotics and acid-reducing medicines. You will need to be tested after treatment to make sure the infection is gone.

To help prevent an H. pylori infection, you should

  • Wash your hands after using the bathroom and before eating
  • Eat properly prepared food
  • Drink water from a clean, safe source

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: H. pylori

carousel_items: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

basics.benefits_moa: Rabeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Rabeprazole is an effective medicine to treat heartburn and ulcers, but can be expensive.
downsides: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

userStories.identifier: Have a lack of stomach lining
userStories.tip: Don't mix it with cold and flu medicine, take before eating if taking early in morning. Not doing either of these causes vomiting.

drugs.name: Aciphex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Rabeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Rabeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Chew or dissolve chewable tablets in mouth.
Shake Pepto Bismol liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.
Don't take Pepto Bismol if you have an allergy to aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.
Can temporarily make your tongue and stools darker.
Stop taking Pepto Bismol and tell your doctor if you notice ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea and vomiting.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Pepto Bismol is a stomach and intestine medicine with multiple effects. It relieves diarrhea by helping your intestines absorb water and electrolytes, and by lowering intestine inflammation and movement. It also has antibacterial and antacid effects.
basics.bottom_line: Pepto Bismol does it all, from upset stomach to crampy diarrhea.
downsides: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

upsides: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves heartburn, upset tummy and diarrhea.

Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye’s Syndrome. Reye’s is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.
risk_factors: Children or teenagers that have or are recovering from flu/flu-like symptoms or chickenpox

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye’s Syndrome. Reye’s is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Hearing problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

carousel_items: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

basics.benefits_moa: Metronidazole is an antibiotic that kills bacteria by cutting off their supply of energy and ruining their DNA.
basics.bottom_line: Metronidazole is a very good way to treat certain bacteria infections, but you can't have any alcohol while on it since it'll make you throw up. A lot.
downsides: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

upsides: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: If you are hypersensitive to medications (i.e., several drug allergies), PLEASE check with your medical professional for alternatives. Side effect (arthralgia - joint pain) are STILL present after 2.5 days of taking, 7 weeks later!
userStories.indication: Was given when PID was suspected (ended up not being)

drugs.name: Flagyl

labeled_indications.indication: Colorectal infection prevention after a surgery

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mental status | Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

risks_warnings.title: Aseptic meningitis
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

description_processed.orig: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

carousel_items: Finish all of the medicine your doctor gives you, even if you start to feel better. Stopping it early can cause the bacteria to develop resistance, making the medicine ineffective.
If you're taking birth control pills, this medication may make them less effective.
Take with food to decrease upsetting your stomach (nausea, vomiting).
If you're giving the suspension, you can mix it with a cold drink, but make sure to take it right away.
Keep the suspension form in the fridge. All other forms should be kept at room temperature.
You may have loose stool when taking this medicine, but it should get better soon after finishing the course. If the diarrhea worsens, tell your doctor.

clock.tip: Doesn't work as quickly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Amoxicillin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria and prevents them from reproducing and making their own protective covering.
basics.bottom_line: Amoxicillin is a good and cheap antibiotic to treat many types of bacterial infections. However, many bacteria are resistant to this medication.
downsides: Suspension must be stored in the fridge.
Can make birth control pills and live vaccines less effective.
Many bacteria have developed resistance to this antibiotic.

downsides_processed.orig: Suspension must be stored in the fridge.
Can make birth control pills and live vaccines less effective.
Many bacteria have developed resistance to this antibiotic.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.

userStories.tip: Do not use fishmox (fish amoxicillin), get it from your doctor instead.
Doesn't matter if you take it with food or not. Make sure you finish the entire course of antibiotics though, very important
Make sure you finish the entire course or the infection can come back worse than ever
Take with probiotics and you'll be fine.  Try 1 cup kefir or greek yogurt low in sugar.
This is the antibiotic I use the most when I'm sick. All my doctors prescribe this and it always works. I have respiratory tract infections every year and this works great with no hassle.

drugs.name: Amoxicillin

off-label_indications.indication: Post exposure prevention for anthrax inhalation

carousel_items_processed.orig: Finish all of the medicine your doctor gives you, even if you start to feel better. Stopping it early can cause the bacteria to develop resistance, making the medicine ineffective.
If you're taking birth control pills, this medication may make them less effective.
Take with food to decrease upsetting your stomach (nausea, vomiting).
If you're giving the suspension, you can mix it with a cold drink, but make sure to take it right away.
Keep the suspension form in the fridge. All other forms should be kept at room temperature.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea from a superinfection (an infection that happens after, or in addition to, an earlier infection)
risks_warnings.description: Taking antibiotics, like Amoxicillin can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: Taking antibiotics, like Amoxicillin can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: If you have had an allergic reaction from taking penicillin-type antibiotics, such as trouble breathing or swelling in your face and neck, let your doctor know before taking this. Amoxicillin may not be right for you and your doctor can prescribe an alternate medicine.

description_processed.orig: If you have had an allergic reaction from taking penicillin-type antibiotics, such as trouble breathing or swelling in your face and neck, let your doctor know before taking this. Amoxicillin may not be right for you and your doctor can prescribe an alternate medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Amoxicillin and you're also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Amoxicillin.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Amoxicillin and you're also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Amoxicillin.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased effectiveness of live vaccines
risks_warnings.description: If you need to get a live vaccine such as Zostavax (for shingles) or typhoid, talk to your doctor since taking Amoxicillin can make the live vaccine less effective.

description_processed.orig: If you need to get a live vaccine such as Zostavax (for shingles) or typhoid, talk to your doctor since taking Amoxicillin can make the live vaccine less effective.

points.name: Vulvovaginal mycotic infection

carousel_items: You might feel better after a few doses, but you'll need to take all the medicine that was prescribed. Not taking all your medicine can cause the bacteria to get stronger and Tetracycline not to work when you need it again in the future.
It doesn't fight viral infections, so it won't work for the common cold.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun. Use sunblock or cover up.
Take your dose at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals, milk, or multivitamins with minerals.
Take your dose with a full glass of water and don't lay down right after taking it to prevent throat irritation.
Can cause nausea, vomiting, belly cramping, and diarrhea.

basics.benefits_moa: Tetracycline is an antibiotic. It prevents bacteria from growing, reproducing, and repairing themselves. It also changes your immune system response (immunomodulating effect), which helps treat skin conditions.
basics.bottom_line: Tetracycline treats many different types of infections and is cheap, but dosing and drug interactions may be somewhat of a hassle.
downsides: For most infections you'll need to take it 4 times a day (or every 6 hours).
It needs to be spaced out from food, milk, vitamins, and some medications.
Can cause tongue darkening, heartburn, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
Tetracycline makes your skin more sensitive to the sun and ultraviolet light. Wear sunblock and protective clothing, and don't go tanning.
Interacts with birth control and makes it less effective. Use a backup form of birth control if you don't want to get pregnant.
Not a good choice for children ages 8 and under. Tetracycline can cause permanent staining of teeth in babies and young children.

downsides_processed.orig: For most infections you'll need to take it 4 times a day (or every 6 hours).
It needs to be spaced out from food, milk, vitamins, and some medications.
Can cause tongue darkening, heartburn, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
Tetracycline makes your skin more sensitive to the sun and ultraviolet light. Wear sunblock and protective clothing, and don't go tanning.
Interacts with birth control and makes it less effective. Use a backup form of birth control if you don't want to get pregnant.
Not a good choice for children ages 8 and under. Tetracycline can cause permanent staining of teeth in babies and young children.

upsides: Effectively treats a wide range of conditions and is used for many different types of infections.
Effective for acne.
Cheap.
Good choice for people on kidney dialysis who need an antibiotic. Tetracycline isn't removed by dialysis, so the dose doesn't need to be changed.

userStories.tip: Never EVER take before laying down and ALWAYS with a full glass of water. You do not want to get an esophageal ulcer.
Take it when you get up, so it waits an hour before breakfast.
I stopped taking it after finding an over the counter cream that was a 10% benzoyl peroxide solution that solved my acne problem the day of.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in teeth
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline and similar medicines can affect the growth and development of teeth in the fetus, infant and in children younger than 8 years old. Avoid using if you're pregnant, breast-feeding, or in children less than 8 years of age and ask your doctor about other effective medicine choices.

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline and similar medicines can affect the growth and development of teeth in the fetus, infant and in children younger than 8 years old. Avoid using if you're pregnant, breast-feeding, or in children less than 8 years of age and ask your doctor about other effective medicine choices.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Tetracycline and also on birth control pills, the birth control might not work. You'll need to use a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Tetracycline if you don't want to get pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Tetracycline and also on birth control pills, the birth control might not work. You'll need to use a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Tetracycline if you don't want to get pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased kidney function and kidney injury
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline can lower your kidney function causing buildup of substances that should be removed from the body. There's a higher risk if you have current problems with your kidneys. It's also important that you don't take Tetracycline past the expiration date on your prescription label. This was more of a problem with older forms of the medicine, which could change and damage your kidneys.
risk_factors: Taking Tetracycline past the expiration date

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline can lower your kidney function causing buildup of substances that should be removed from the body. There's a higher risk if you have current problems with your kidneys. It's also important that you don't take Tetracycline past the expiration date on your prescription label. This was more of a problem with older forms of the medicine, which could change and damage your kidneys.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Tetracycline and have to be outside in the sun for any amount of time, make sure you wear sunblock on exposed parts of your body or protective clothing. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and you're at a higher risk for sunburn.
risk_factors: Exposure to sunlight or ultraviolet light

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Tetracycline and have to be outside in the sun for any amount of time, make sure you wear sunblock on exposed parts of your body or protective clothing. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and you're at a higher risk for sunburn.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: You should avoid taking Tetracycline if you think you may get pregnant. Tetracycline can affect tooth and bone formation in the developing fetus and infant. The risk is greater the longer you take it, but can happen even with repeated short treatments. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor first about safer medicine choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: You should avoid taking Tetracycline if you think you may get pregnant. Tetracycline can affect tooth and bone formation in the developing fetus and infant. The risk is greater the longer you take it, but can happen even with repeated short treatments. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor first about safer medicine choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased pressure in the brain
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline may cause increased pressure in the brain, called pseudotumor cerebri in infants and adults. There's more risk if you also take the drug Accutane. If you notice symptoms of nausea, vomiting, or pounding headache stop taking it and your symptoms should improve. Your doctor can check for changes in your eyes (optic disc swelling) before having you continue treatment.
risk_factors: Taking with Tetracycline with other medicines that can cause this effect (e.g. Accutane)

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline may cause increased pressure in the brain, called pseudotumor cerebri in infants and adults. There's more risk if you also take the drug Accutane. If you notice symptoms of nausea, vomiting, or pounding headache stop taking it and your symptoms should improve. Your doctor can check for changes in your eyes (optic disc swelling) before having you continue treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Liver injury
risks_warnings.description: Liver injury can happen rarely with Tetracycline. There's a higher risk if you have kidney disease. Your doctor should check your liver function before starting you on Tetracycline.

description_processed.orig: Liver injury can happen rarely with Tetracycline. There's a higher risk if you have kidney disease. Your doctor should check your liver function before starting you on Tetracycline.

risks_warnings.title: Development of more serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Using Tetracycline for a long period of time can cause a fungal infection or more serious bacterial infection including c-difficile diarrhea and severe colitis.  It can happen more than 2 months after stopping treatment. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Tetracycline or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using Tetracycline for a long period of time can cause a fungal infection or more serious bacterial infection including c-difficile diarrhea and severe colitis.  It can happen more than 2 months after stopping treatment. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Tetracycline or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

carousel_items: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Azithromycin is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease, myasthenia gravis, or on medications to thin the blood, as the doctor may write an alternative.
downsides: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

downsides_processed.orig: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

drugs.name: Azithromycin

off-label_indications.indication: STI prevention for victims of sexual assault

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening of myasthenia gravis
risks_warnings.description: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

description_processed.orig: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

carousel_items: Take Prevacid about 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules, but swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing, there's a tablet available that dissolves in your mouth.
Give Prevacid a chance to work. You'll see some benefits right away, but the full effects can take a week or so to kick in.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Prevacid.

basics.benefits_moa: Prevacid is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Prevacid gives you long-lasting heartburn relief and helps heal ulcers.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Depending on the condition you are treating, it can take one to two weeks to get the full effect.
If you are taking Prevacid for a long time you should take a calcium supplement to prevent fragile bones.
Can interact with other drugs, so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Prevacid.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Depending on the condition you are treating, it can take one to two weeks to get the full effect.
If you are taking Prevacid for a long time you should take a calcium supplement to prevent fragile bones.
Can interact with other drugs, so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Prevacid.

upsides: Most people can take Prevacid without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Prevacid lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Sometimes if one PPI doesn't work, another medication in the same class will work for you.

Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Sometimes if one PPI doesn't work, another medication in the same class will work for you.

userStories.tip: take  2 times a day, once before  breakfast and once before dinner
take 2 times a day half hour  before meals
I take it before bed because presumably during the night is when small amounts of stomach acid can travel up my esophagus and damage my swallowing mechanism.
userStories.indication: GERD whose only symptom is choking when swallowing.

userStories.tip: If you take chronically, be sure to get Magnesium level tested. If you start to experience rapid heartbeat episodes, it is probably from low Magnesium related to long term proton pump inhibitor use.
userStories.indication: GERD diagnosed after swallowing problems noted

drugs.name: Prevacid

labeled_indications.indication: Stomach ulcer prevention while taking a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
condition_url_name: Stomach ulcer from non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Prevacid about 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules, but swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing, there's a tablet available that dissolves in your mouth.
Give Prevacid a chance to work. You'll see some benefits right away, but the full effects can take a week or so to kick in.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Prevacid.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Prevacid for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Prevacid for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Prevacid.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Prevacid for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Prevacid.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Prevacid for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Prevacid (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Prevacid or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Prevacid (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Prevacid or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Prevacid (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Prevacid.  However, if you need to take Prevacid long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Prevacid (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Prevacid.  However, if you need to take Prevacid long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Prevacid, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Prevacid for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

description_processed.orig: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Prevacid, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Prevacid for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

basics.benefits_moa: Simvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Simvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

my numbers look better and I can only attribute those results to this drug. I did nothing differently.

drugs.name: Simvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.
risk_factors: Combining Simvastatin with certain cholesterol-lowering drugs

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Certain drugs can increase the dose of Simvastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

description_processed.orig: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.
